data.title: Update Translation & Delete useless file
Request: make help > about text selectable
data.body: Since it's useful to report the exact commit that have an issue, could make the text inside the about dialog selectable, so it can be copied and pasted

data.title: Fedora & DNF minor changes.
data.body:
Just an enhancement for Fedora. Now, we can add a repo file directly from dnf.
```
sudo rpm --import https://packages.microsoft.com/keys/microsoft.asc
sudo dnf config-manager --add-repo https://gist.github.com/concatime/fb8875a2d0d4eecce8adec469cbddf21/raw/vscode.repo
```
The second line will add the file from the link to ` /etc/yum.repos.d/vscode.repo`.
**The path file needs to finish with `.repo`.**
So It could be nice If You provide the link to the file and update the wiki/setup page.

Sources:
> https://docs.fedoraproject.org/en-US/Fedora/23/html/System_Administrators_Guide/sec-Managing_DNF_Repositories.html
https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/setup/linux#_rhel-fedora-and-centos-based-distributions

data.title: Intellisense autocomplete does not work well for JS
data.body:
<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.4.2
- OS Version: Linux 4.8.0-58-generic #63~16.04.1-Ubuntu SMP Mon Jun 26 18:08:51 UTC 2017 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Created simple bot app with node js (code mentioned below). Auto-complete works fine in line 22 for `session` parameter. 
2. However does not work in line 29 for `session` parameter (in ReceiveMessage() function) even with JSDoc definitions.

```
var restify = require('restify');
var builder = require('botbuilder');

// Setup Restify Server
var server = restify.createServer();
server.listen(process.env.port || process.env.PORT || 3978, function () {
   console.log('%s listening to %s', server.name, server.url); 
});

// Create chat connector for communicating with the Bot Framework Service
var connector = new builder.ChatConnector({
    appId: process.env.MICROSOFT_APP_ID,
    appPassword: process.env.MICROSOFT_APP_PASSWORD
});

// Listen for messages from users 
server.post('/api/messages', connector.listen());

// Receive messages from the user and respond by echoing each message back (prefixed with 'You said:')
var dialog = require("./rootdialog")
var bot = new builder.UniversalBot(connector, function (session) {
    session.send("You said: %s", session.message.text);
});

/**
 * @param {Session} {session}
 */
function ReceiveMessage(/*Session*/session) {
    session.send("You said: %s", session.message.text);    
}
```

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
**VS Code for Node.js Development Quickstart Pack** extension installed, does not work without it as well.

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Test TSConfig Task Provider for multiroot
data.body:
For #30415

**Size:** 2
**OS:**
- [x] Linux @aefernandes 
- [x] Mac @Tyriar 
- [x] Windows @chrmarti

# Overview
The TSConfig task provider now supports multiroot workspaces. When using the tasks 2.0 build command, it should pick up all `tsconfig` files from all workspaces.

# Scenarios
1. In a single folder workspace, create top level `tsconfig.json`. Ensure it is picked up by the build task
1. Now add some tsconfigs in subfolders. Ensure these are picked up too
1. Add a new folder to the workspace. Create a `tsconfig.json` in this folder. Ensure this is picked up and that all previous configs are still shown too. The tsc tasks should now be labeled with the folder name at the start.
1. Remove the added folder. Tsconfigs from this folder should be removed as well.
1. Add the folder back. Ensure the tsconfigs from this folder are picked up again

# Other things to try
- We should support any `tsconfig.*.json` file names anywhere in a folder
- `file.exclude` should prevent a `tsconfig` from being picked up
- Try adding folders with the same name.
- Try adding folders that are subfolders of each other. There should only be one entry for each tsconfig

data.title: Git commit field should have a monospace font
data.body:
As git commit messages are often constrained to a certain number of characters, it makes sense for the commit field to have a monospace font (and probably a ruler at a configurable position, like the editor), so each line can be aligned predictably.

It would be nice to extend monospace fonts to more things, like the command palette, which would fit more in line with the command-line metaphor (same as Atom)

data.title: Tab close icon's usability can be improved
data.body:
Currently the active appearance of a tab close icon scales it by a small amount.

![close](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4211302/28482024-75747e78-6e5e-11e7-9339-4fe8e8c2c828.gif)

To me this has always felt a bit off, as it goes against a lot of clicking affordance that we see on most UIs, which is generally an altered background. Scaling or elevation works with material design because each element is usually its own card which can transform by itself.

I made a change in devtools using the `filter()` function for the active state, and I think it feels a lot more natural

![close-alt](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4211302/28482163-1cdc1c48-6e5f-11e7-8387-eefa9c521413.gif)

Also, since both the cursor is set to `pointer` on the entire tab, *and* there isn't hover state for the close icon, there's no hover affordance to the user to tell them that they are on something clickable. Probably either `cursor: pointer` should only be set on the icon .. or there should be a distinct hover state on the icon (like Atom)

>![close-atom 1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4211302/28482529-ae2a1744-6e60-11e7-8fb4-9c2e94e92322.gif)
>--Atom example

data.title: VSCode Insiders not added to context menu after automatic upgrade to 64 bit version
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.15.0-insider x64
- OS Version: Windows 10 Version 1703 Build 16241.1001

Today VSCode Insiders asked me if I wanted to upgrade to the 64 bit version. I clicked on yes and apparently the download started on background. After some time, a number showed up on top of the Gear icon on the bottom left corner (updates available). After selecting restart and install updates, it first uninstalled the current version and then it installed the 64 bit version. The process executed and completed automatically, there were no prompts.
App runs normally so far, but it was not added to the context menu in Explorer.

data.title: Cannot launch vscode from the command line
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.14.2
- OS Version: Linux x64 4.4.0-64-generic (Ubuntu 14.04)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Simply run `code` or `code <dir>/<file>` in the terminal and it cannot launch vscode. Downgrading to 1.13 can fix the problem.

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

The output of `code --verbose`:
```
(code:10048): dconf-CRITICAL **: unable to create directory '/run/user/szefany/dconf': Permission denied.  dconf will not work properly.
(code:10048): dconf-CRITICAL **: unable to create directory '/run/user/szefany/dconf': Permission denied.  dconf will not work properly.

(code:10048): dconf-CRITICAL **: unable to create directory '/run/user/szefany/dconf': Permission denied.  dconf will not work properly.

(code:10048): dconf-CRITICAL **: unable to create directory '/run/user/szefany/dconf': Permission denied.  dconf will not work properly.

(code:10048): dconf-CRITICAL **: unable to create directory '/run/user/szefany/dconf': Permission denied.  dconf will not work properly.

(code:10048): dconf-CRITICAL **: unable to create directory '/run/user/szefany/dconf': Permission denied.  dconf will not work properly.
(code:10048): dconf-CRITICAL **: unable to create directory '/run/user/szefany/dconf': Permission denied.  dconf will not work properly.
(code:10048): dconf-CRITICAL **: unable to create directory '/run/user/szefany/dconf': Permission denied.  dconf will not work properly.
[10077:0722/024515.981541:ERROR:gl_context_glx.cc(187)] Failed to create GL context with glXCreateContextAttribsARB.
[10077:0722/024515.981607:ERROR:gpu_info_collector.cc(50)] gl::init::CreateGLContext failed
[10077:0722/024515.981610:ERROR:gpu_info_collector.cc(118)] Could not create context for info collection.
[10077:0722/024515.981618:ERROR:gpu_init.cc(85)] gpu::CollectGraphicsInfo failed (fatal).
[10077:0722/024515.982416:ERROR:gpu_child_thread.cc(327)] Exiting GPU process due to errors during initialization
Error: listen EACCES /run/user/szefany/Code-1.14.2-main.sock
    at Object.exports._errnoException (util.js:1022:11)
    at exports._exceptionWithHostPort (util.js:1045:20)
    at Server._listen2 (net.js:1249:19)
    at listen (net.js:1298:10)
    at Server.listen (net.js:1382:7)
    at /usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/code/electron-main/main.js:4:133560
    at new n.Class.derive._oncancel (/usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/code/electron-main/main.js:4:74325)
    at Object.t.serve (/usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/code/electron-main/main.js:4:133490)
    at i (/usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/code/electron-main/main.js:4:312624)
    at A (/usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/code/electron-main/main.js:4:313713)
```

After double checking, I found only `/run/user/1000` instead of `/run/user/szefany`, and that's why there are some `unable to create directory` errors above. Then I created a soft link `/run/user/szefany` to `/run/user/1000` and the problem was solved.

data.title: Colorizer. Background highlight per code block

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
This is a feature request for the ability to colorize the _background_ of code blocks, rather than just the text/tokens themselves.  Normally text coloring is quite sufficient, but I have come across situations, namely Python, where the ability to color the current code block/context that my active cursor is in, would be **_extremely_** useful. The styling would be much like the current line highlighting (changing as the cursor moves) but for context. The `contextHighlight` would be inclusive of the start of context and end of context. Certainly language support would have to be there, but currently I don't even see a mechanism to change specific lines' backgrounds. Functionality example below...

Example:

```python
# start of file, start context a
# here my context would be of the file, say context a
# and the entire file would have contextHighlight of a
for i in range(10): # start context b
    # here my context would be context b
    # and have the matching contextHighlight b
    print(i)
    for j in range(5): # start context c
        # here my context would be context c
        # and have the matching contextHighlight c
        print(j) # end context b, end context c
# end context a
```

data.title: The cog hides new visual studio code updates too well
data.body:
<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.14.*
- OS Version: Windows 10

Since the update which added the cog I've already missed 2 versions as I just don't look at that region of the screen very much - It is *too* hidden and out of the way. I'm not sure what other people's experience is with this but I thought I would put it out there just in case people agree with me.

1) There's no real reason look in that region of the screen. Apart from updates, but it seems a bit odd to have people learn to consciously check just for updates as that can lead to distracting behaviour. 
2) I have a bigger than average monitor 1440p @ 27" which just hides the cog in so much more space. It is slightly easier to accidentally come across on a 1080p 15.4" laptop monitor but again it's not ideal.

If the optional settings approach isn't ideal, maybe some of these other solutions may be more appealing:

- Add a small notification to the extensions tab as well? With it being so close to the other menu options it would be easier to spot
- Move the cog above the `Finder` option and add a break line to separate it from the rest of the menu options
- Add a somewhat noticeable gradient to the menu bar when vscode has an update? Nothing too bright like red. But the idea is to draw your eyes to the cog with a noticeable change

This is more of a quality of life suggestion rather than a need, so other user feedback would benefit this post more than others.

data.title: Auto-detected Tasks not showing NPM script tasks if a parent folder
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.14.2
- OS Version: Win 10 (14393)

When the package.json file is in a sub folder of the one opened in VSCode (therefore not in the root), the tasks in the scripts section are not auto detected. I did test opening VSCode with the folder that contains the package.json file directly and the tasks were autodetected correctly, it just seems to be if its in a parent folder that the issue is caused.

This might be expected behaviour, although in the same project I had a tsconfig.json file in the same folder as package.json and it was detected in a subfolder when the package.json tasks were not detected. Ideally it would be better to autodetect in a sub folder like the tsconfig.json file does.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open VSCode with parent folder above the folder containing package.json (so its not in the root) 
2. Click task in menu bar
3. Click Run Task to get the list of auto detected scripts. List should not show the tasks from the scripts section of package.json

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

Thank you, apologies if I missed something

data.title: Revert to old update process or make the gear more prominent
data.body:
Please revert to the old update process via the notification bar. The "Lighter update experience" would be fine as a flag, but it's SO out of the way that I end up not noticing it for days.

So my request would be that the old notification is a toggle or the "gear" that houses the update notification be moved up next to the other icons on the side bar so that it's in my field of vision at a location that I'm used to looking.

{
    "version": "0.2.0",

            "name": "Launch Program",

}

data.title: TextDocument.getText doesn't return the latest text
[Feature request] Setting Syncronization
data.body:
Dear VS Code Dev Team

I always use many different PCs, and each time I want to add/change some settings/snippets/extensions/keyboard shortcuts/etc,  I have to do the same thing in all the PCs. It's kinda unfavorable. 
So I hope you, The VS Code Dev Team will make things easier for me (And everyone else of course) <3 

From VN with hope  ɛɝ
Gấu
